block.p: Cecilia Ebba Ahrbom, a daughter of Ann-Charlotte and Per Ahrbom of Saltsjo-Duvnas, Sweden, was married yesterday to Andrew Charkin Weiler, the son of Eileen Weiler Judell of New York and the late Henry Weiler. The Rev. Inga Ahrbom, an aunt of the bride and Lutheran minister, performed the ceremony at the Saltsjo-Boo Old Chapel in Stockholm.

Mrs. Weiler, 34, is the deputy group counsel for the PA Consulting Group, a management consulting firm in London. She graduated with a law degree from Uppsala University in Sweden. Her parents are architects in private practice in Stockholm.

Cecilia Ebba Ahrbom, a daughter of Ann-Charlotte and Per Ahrbom of Saltsjo-Duvnas, Sweden, was married yesterday to Andrew Charkin Weiler, the son of Eileen Weiler Judell of New York and the late Henry Weiler. The Rev. Inga Ahrbom, an aunt of the bride and Lutheran minister, performed the ceremony at the Saltsjo-Boo Old Chapel in Stockholm.

Mrs. Weiler, 34, is the deputy group counsel for the PA Consulting Group, a management consulting firm in London. She graduated with a law degree from Uppsala University in Sweden. Her parents are architects in private practice in Stockholm.

Mr. Weiler, 32, is an associate in the London office of White & Case, the law firm. He graduated from Dartmouth College and Duke University Law School. His mother is an independent reading tutor in New York. His father was a partner in Cole & Dietz, a New York law firm. The bridegroom's stepfather, Robert B. Judell, is the chief executive of James Thompson & Company, textile importers and manufacturers in New York.
